sect2.title: Introduction to XFS
sect2.para: The XFS package contains administration and debugging tools for the XFS file system.

sect2.title: Installation of XFS
sect2.para: Install XFS by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: XFS contains fsck.xfs, mkfs.xfs, xfs_admin, xfs_bmap, xfs_check, xfs_copy, xfs_db, xfs_freeze, xfs_growfs, xfs_info, xfs_io, xfs_logprint, xfs_mkfile, xfs_ncheck, xfs_repair and xfs_rtcp.

sect3.title: fsck.xfs
sect3.para: fsck.xfs simply exits with a zero status, since XFS partitions are checked at mount time.

sect3.title: mkfs.xfs
sect3.para: mkfs.xfs constructs an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_admin
sect3.para: xfs_admin changes the parameters of an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_bmap
sect3.para: xfs_bmap prints block mapping for an XFS file.

sect3.title: xfs_check
sect3.para: xfs_check checks XFS file system consistency.

sect3.title: xfs_copy
sect3.para: xfs_copy copies the contents of an XFS file system to one or more targets in parallel.

sect3.title: xfs_db
sect3.para: xfs_db is used to debug an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_freeze
sect3.para: xfs_freeze suspends access to an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_growfs
sect3.para: xfs_growfs expands an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_info
sect3.para: xfs_info is equivalent to invoking xfs_growfs, but specifying that no change to the file system is to be made.

sect3.title: xfs_io
sect3.para: xfs_io is a debugging tool like xfs_db, but is aimed at examining the regular file I/O path rather than the raw XFS volume itself.

sect3.title: xfs_logprint
sect3.para: xfs_logprint prints the log of an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_mkfile
sect3.para: xfs_mkfile creates an XFS file, padded with zeroes by default.

sect3.title: xfs_ncheck
sect3.para: xfs_ncheck generates pathnames from inode numbers for an XFS file system.

sect3.title: xfs_repair
sect3.para: xfs_repair repairs corrupt or damaged XFS file systems.

sect3.title: xfs_rtcp
sect3.para: xfs_rtcp copies a file to the real-time partition on an XFS file system.
